questions.question: What is the main principle of Agile methodology?
questions.explanation: Agile emphasizes iterative development with frequent customer feedback and adaptation.

questions.question: What does UML stand for?
questions.explanation: UML (Unified Modeling Language) is used for visualizing software system designs.

questions.question: What is version control used for?
questions.explanation: Version control systems track and manage changes to source code over time.

questions.question: What is unit testing?
questions.explanation: Unit testing involves testing individual components or modules in isolation.

questions.question: What does SOLID principles help with?
questions.explanation: SOLID principles guide good object-oriented design and programming practices.

questions.question: What is the purpose of code review?
questions.explanation: Code review ensures code quality, catches bugs, and promotes knowledge sharing.

questions.question: What is Continuous Integration (CI)?
questions.explanation: CI automatically integrates code changes and runs tests to detect issues early.

questions.question: Which design pattern ensures only one instance of a class exists?
questions.explanation: Singleton pattern restricts class instantiation to a single instance.
